References

Blajenkova, O., Kozhevnikov, M., & Motes, M. A. (2006). Object-spatial imagery: a new self-report imagery questionnaire. Applied Cognitive Psychology, 20(2), 239-263. https://doi.org/10.1002/acp.1182
Syed, A. A., Neelofur, S., Moran, A., & O’Reilly, G. (2020). Exploring the vividness of mental imagery and eidetic imagery in people with intellectual disability (ID) in comparison with typically developing (TD) individuals. Heliyon, 6(11), e05429. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.heliyon.2020.e05429
Michael J. Beran, Brielle T. James, Kristin French, Elizabeth L. Haseltine, Heather M. Kleider-Offutt, Assessing Aphantasia Prevalence and the Relation of Self-Reported Imagery Abilities and Memory Task Performance, Consciousness and Cognition,Volume 113,2023,103548, ISSN 1053-8100, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.concog.2023.103548.
https://aphantasia.com/vviq/
